title: Michael Cheika quits as Australia coach following Rugby World Cup loss by England
text:
Michael Cheika quit as Australia coach after his seventh consecutive mauling by England having been dumped out of the World Cup.

And he left with a stinging rebuke to his bosses.

'It is no secret I have no relationship with the CEO and not much with the chairman,' he said.

Michael Cheika (pictured) has confirmed he will not continue as Australia coach beyond 2019

After the 40-16 defeat on Saturday night in Oita Cheika criticised questions about his future.

'I'm being honest,' he said when asked if he would resign. 'It's a cruel, cruel world nowadays when you're asked those questions two minutes after your World Cup is finished.

'If you'd find it inside you to find a little bit of compassion just to ask more relevant questions... think about people's feelings for a minute. Just chill.

'I came here with only one thought in my mind about winning and that thought's just disappeared now. Not 15 or 20 minutes ago. When the time comes, I'll tell it. Sweet?

Australia suffered a humiliating World Cup quarter-final defeat by England on Saturday

'I know that is what the papers demand but perhaps whatever your news outlet is should think about people's feelings just for a minute.

'When the time comes I'll tell them (Australia Rugby Football Union). They don't need to know today. It's not going to kill them.'

But now the Wallabies coach has left his role. He took over Australia in 2014 and led them to the World Cup final of 2015 – but this early exit has seen him fall on his sword.

Glasgow Warriors boss and New Zealander Dave Rennie, has been linked with the post.
description: WILL KELLEHER IN OITA: Michael Cheika quit as Australia coach after his seventh consecutive mauling by England having been dumped out of the Rugby World Cup.
